1.text: Then answered Zophar the Naamathite, and said,

2.text: Should not the multitude of words be answered? And should a man full of talk be justified?

3.text: Should thy boastings make men hold their peace? And when thou mockest, shall no man make thee ashamed?

4.text: For thou sayest, My doctrine is pure, And I am clean in thine eyes.

5.text: But oh that God would speak, And open his lips against thee,

6.text: And that he would show thee the secrets of wisdom! For he is manifold in understanding. Know therefore that God exacteth of thee less than thine iniquity deserveth.

7.text: Canst thou by searching find out God? Canst thou find out the Almighty unto perfection?

8.text: It is high as heaven; what canst thou do? Deeper than Sheol; what canst thou know?

9.text: The measure thereof is longer than the earth, And broader than the sea.

10.text: If he pass through, and shut up, And call unto judgment, then who can hinder him?

11.text: For he knoweth false men: He seeth iniquity also, even though he consider it not.

12.text: But vain man is void of understanding, Yea, man is born as a wild assâ€™s colt.

13.text: If thou set thy heart aright, And stretch out thy hands toward him;

14.text: If iniquity be in thy hand, put it far away, And let not unrighteousness dwell in thy tents.

15.text: Surely then shalt thou lift up thy face without spot; Yea, thou shalt be stedfast, and shalt not fear:

16.text: For thou shalt forget thy misery; Thou shalt remember it as waters that are passed away,

17.text: And thy life shall be clearer than the noonday; Though there be darkness, it shall be as the morning.

18.text: And thou shalt be secure, because there is hope; Yea, thou shalt search about thee, and shalt take thy rest in safety.

19.text: Also thou shalt lie down, and none shall make thee afraid; Yea, many shall make suit unto thee.

20.text: But the eyes of the wicked shall fail, And they shall have no way to flee; And their hope shall be the giving up of the ghost.
